page.title: 16Springhead C.P. School Talke
page.content: My school is called Springhead County Primary School.It was opened in January 1961.It was named after the spring just outside the school grounds.A new housing estate was built around that time in Talke Pits and the school was built so that children could go to school near their homes .Children come to Springhead when they are about five years old and leave when they are eleven.Then they have to go to Clough Hall Comprehensive School in Kidsgrove.The school has seven classrooms.Classes one,two and three are for infants and four,five,six and seven are for juniors.There used to be another infants school in Talke Pits called St.Martins.When it closed in 1983, 18 of its children came to Springhead.Springhead has had three headmasters:Mr Gleaves,Mr Mountford and Mr Newnes.
